edu.ncsu.csc.githubmanager.manager

Class GitHubManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.githubmanager.manager.GitHubManager

  • public class GitHubManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The GitHubManager program allows you to: (1) assign students to GitHub teams and repositories by providing a formatted input file of repository assignments; and (2) update permissions (read, write, admin) for GitHub teams When assigning repositories, students are added to GitHub teams that have the same name as the GitHub repository they will be assigned. Using GitHub teams allows fine-grained permissions and access controls.
    Author:
    Jason King, Sarah Heckman

      • updateTeamPermissions

        public void updateTeamPermissions(java.lang.String prefix,
                                  org.kohsuke.github.GHOrganization.Permission permission)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  java.lang.InterruptedException
        Updates team permissions for the repository. Prefix represents the first part of the team name, such as: "csc316-001-P1" will match all teams whose names begin with that prefix, but will not affect other teams in the organization
        Parameters:
        prefix - - team name prefix, such as "CSC316-001-P1"
        permission - - permission to set for the team's repo
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error sending/receiving information from GitHub
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while sleeping

        Creates a team with the provided team name
        Parameters:
        teamName - - the name of the team
        Returns:
        the GitHub Team object that represents the team that was created
